```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(quanteda)
library(skimr)
library(lubridate)
library(ggthemes)
library(tidyverse)
load("data_collection/tweets_training_data.RData")
```


```{r echo=FALSE}
# some initial summary statistics
skim(training_data)

# some further data cleaning. Taking out all retweets
dic_data <- training_data %>%
  filter(is_retweet == FALSE) %>%
  mutate(date = ymd(str_sub(created_at, 1, 10))) %>%
  filter(date >= as.Date("2020-11-03"))
```


```{r}
# visualizing the data set -- looking at amount of tweets over time 

dic_data %>%
  group_by(date) %>% 
  count() %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = n)) +
  geom_point() +
  theme_clean()
```
